array.string: I. Global/Regional Dysfunction and Structural Alterations
II. Tissue Characterizations of Wall
III. Repolarization Abnormalities
IV. Depolarization and Conduction Abnormalities
V. Arrhythmias
VI. Family History
2D Echo: Regional RV akinesia, dyskinesia, or aneurysm WITH PLAX RVOT ≥ 32 mm (PLAX/BSA ≥ 19 mm/m²) OR WITH PSAX RVOT ≥ 36 mm (PLAX/BSA ≥ 21 mm/m²) OR fractional area change ≤ 33%
MRI: Regional RV akinesia, dyskinesia, or aneurysm WITH ratio of RV EDV/BSA ≥110 mL/m² (male) or ≥ 100 mL/m² (female) OR RV EF ≤ 40%
RV Angiography: Regional RV akinesia, dyskinesia, or aneurysm

2D Echo: Regional RV akinesia, dyskinesia, or aneurysm WITH PLAX RVOT ≥ 29 to < 32 mm (PLAX/BSA ≥ 16 to > 19 mm/m²) OR WITH PSAX RVOT ≥ 32 to < 36 mm (PLAX/BSA ≥ 18 to < 21 mm/m²) OR fractional area change > 33% and ≤ 40%
MRI: Regional RV akinesia, dyskinesia, or aneurysm with ratio of RV EDV/BSA ≥100 to < 110 mL/m² (male) or ≥ 90 to < 100 mL/m² (female) OR RV EF > 40% to ≤ 45%

Residual myocytes < 60% by morphometric analysis (or < 50% if estimated) with fibrous replacement of RV free wall myocardium in ≥ 1 sample, with or without fatty replacement of tissue on endomyocardial biopsy

Residual myocytes 60% to 70% by morphometric analysis (or 50% to 60% if estimated) with fibrous replacement of RV free wall myocardium in ≥ 1 sample, with or without fatty replacement of tissue on endomyocardial biopsy
T wave inversion (V1, V2, and V3) or beyond in individuals > 14 yrs (in absence of complete RBBB)
T wave inversion in V1 and V2 in individuals > 14 yrs (in absence of complete RBBB) or in V4, V5, V6
T wave inversion in V1-V4 in individuals > 14 yrs in presence of complete RBBB
Epsilon wave (reproducible low-amplitude signals between end of QRS complex to onset of T ave) in right precordial leads (V1-V3)
Late potentials on SAECG in absence of QRS duration ≥ 110 msec on standard ECG: Filtered QRS duration ≥ 114 msec
Late potentials on SAECG in absence of QRS duration ≥ 110 msec on standard ECG: Duration of terminal QRS < 40 µV (low amplitude signal duration) ≥ 38 msec
Late potentials on SAECG in absence of QRS duration ≥ 110 msec on standard ECG: Root-mean-square voltage of terminal 40 msec ≤ 20 µV
Terminal activation duration of QRS ≥ 55 msec measured from the nadir of the S wave to the end of the QRS including R', in V1, V2, or V3, in the absence of complete RBBB
Nonsustained or sustained VT of LBBB morphology with superior axis (negative or indeterminate QRS in leads II, III, and aVF and positive in lead aVL)
Nonsustained or sustained VT of RV outflow configuration, LBBB morphology with inferior axis (positive QRS in leads II, III, and aVF and negative in lead aVL) or of unknown axis
> 500 ventricular extrasystoles per 24 hours (by Holter)
ARVC/D confirmed in a first-degree relative who meets current Task Force criteria
ARVC/D confirmed apthologically at autopsy or surgery in a first-degree relative
Identification of a pathogenic mutation categorized as associated or probably asoociated with ARC/D in the patient under evaluation
History of ARVC/D in a first-degree relative in whom it is not possible or practical to determine whether the family member meets current Task Force criteria
Premature sudden death (< 35 years of age) due to suspected ARVC/D in a first-degree relative
ARVC/D confirmed pathologically or by current Task Force Cirteria in a second-degree relative
Severe dilatation and reduction of RVEF with no or only mild LV impairment
Localized RV aneurysms (akinetic or dyskinetic areas with diastolic bulging)
Severe segmental dilatation of the RV
Mild global RV dilatation and/or EF reduction with normal LV
Mild segmental dilatation of the RV
Regional RV hypokinesia
Fibrofatty replacement of myocardium on endomyocardial biopsy
T wave inversion in leads V2 and V3, with age > 12 yrsin absence of complete RBBB)
Epsilon wave or localized prolongation (> 110 msec) of QRS complex in leads V1 to V3
Late potentials on SAECG
Sustained or nonsustained ventricular tachycardia with LBBB morphology on ECG, Holter or treadmill test
> 1000 ventricular extrasystoles per 24 hours
Familial ARVC/D confirmed at autopsy or surgery
Family history of sudden death (< 35 yrs) due to suspected ARVC/d
Family history of ARVC/D based on these criteria
Secondary Prevention
Primary Prevention
Exclusions
Documented cardiac arrest, without transient or reversible cause
Documented sustained VT/VF, either spontaneous or induced at EPS, not associated with an acute MI, and without transient or reversible cause
Documented familial or inherited condition with a high risk of life-threatening VT, e.g. LQTS or HCM
Ischemic cardiomyopathy
Nonischemic cardiomyopathy
CM duration > 3 months
Documented prior MI
Inducible sustained VT/VF at EPS
QRS duration ≥ 120 msec
Cardiogenic shock or symptomatic hypotension
CABG or PCI within past 3 months
Acute MI within past 40 days
EPS performed within 4 weeks post-MI
Symptoms or findings that would make patient a candidate for revascularization
Non-cardiac disease with likelihood of survival < 1 year
Irreversible brain damage from preexisting cerebral disease
